channel.title: Java Download Help
channel.description:
Hello,
I have just installed Ubuntu over my Windows and now have Ubuntu as my main OS.
I am brand new to Linux and I wanted to download Java.
I download JDK 6.0_02 with JRE, as a .bin, but I cannot open the file.
How do I open the file to install Java?
If you can help, thank you.
-Mrquarter

item.title: Java Download Help
item.dc:creator: @Mrquarter Mrquarter
item.description:
@Mrquarter wrote:

Ok.

Thank you Thug.

I got Adapt Manager on the computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Download Help
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Guess i should of tried ubuntu before i opened my mouth

Read full topic

item.title: Java Download Help
item.dc:creator: @TestDummy TestDummy
item.description:
@TestDummy wrote:

Adept is the KDE frontend to apt-get.
Which you wouldn’t have if you’re using Ubuntu. (As opposed to Kubuntu)

Synaptic would be what you’d be looking for.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Download Help
item.dc:creator: @Mrquarter Mrquarter
item.description:
@Mrquarter wrote:

Yea, it isn’t in Sytem. Damn Ubuntu…But I will look into getting it lolz…

I do see Add/Remove, I will check there.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Download Help
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Mrquarter, post:11, topic:144895”]I got Java Plugin to work, thanks MITB…

Just have a look through adept manager, and search for what you need, don’t be so specific though.

Where is Adept manager???
Sorry, I just got Ubuntu like 2 days ago.[/quote]
Start menu > system?
If not click on the ‘Add/remove applications/programs’ can’t remember the exact name but you should know what i mean.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Download Help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mrquarter, post:6, topic:144895”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=198497.msg1768667#msg1768667 date=1190270337]
Look at the command they use, most of it will be something like:

java Server

You can just type that in the command line, or write a shell script with that command and run it just like you would a .bat on windows.

edit:

The main difference is in linux instead of ‘;’ you use ‘:’
[/quote]
Okay…

It extracted and it said everything was installed, but yet www.moparisthebest.com won’t work. It says missing plugin…lol

Anything I have to do extra?[/quote]

sudo apt-get install sun-java6-plugin

I think…

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mrquarter wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:5, topic:144895”]Look at the command they use, most of it will be something like:

You can just type that in the command line, or write a shell script with that command and run it just like you would a .bat on windows.

item.title: Java Download Help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Look at the command they use, most of it will be something like:

java Server

You can just type that in the command line, or write a shell script with that command and run it just like you would a .bat on windows.

edit:

The main difference is in linux instead of ‘;’ you use ‘:’

Read full topic

item.title: Java Download Help
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

Click on “Applications” on the top menu, then “Accessories” and select “Terminal”.

Mrquarter:

Also, for a server (MSCP), how do I run it, because most servers use a bat.

If it doesn’t come with a “run.sh” file or something of that sort, you’ll have to look in the batch file and make your own shell script from it. To run the sh file, simply cd to the location of your shell file, and run “sh yourfile.sh”.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Download Help
item.dc:creator: @Mrquarter Mrquarter
item.description:
@Mrquarter wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:2, topic:144895”]open a terminal, type in:

sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jdk

Hit enter, and then you are done.[/quote]
Thank you so much, it worked.

Also, for a server (MSCP), how do I run it, because most servers use a bat.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Download Help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

open a terminal, type in:

sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jdk

Hit enter, and then you are done.

Read full topic
